title: What you don't know about who you will become

options.text: Because they are not able to change their preferences.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B

title: Your words may predict your future mental health

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea that Julian Jaynes proposed in the 1970s?

options.label: A
options.text: That humans have always had the same ability to imagine and be conscious.

options.label: B
options.text: That the social transformations that have shaped our culture may have also changed the structural columns of human thought.

options.label: C
options.text: That only 3,000 years ago, humans were what today we would call schizophrenics.

options.label: D
options.text: That consciousness is a recent cultural development.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the problem with Jaynes's theory?

options.label: A
options.text: It's based on too many examples.

options.label: B
options.text: It's built on just a few and very specific examples.

options.label: D
options.text: It's not supported by scientific evidence.

multiple-choice.question: What is the space of words, and how is it constructed?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a space of words that are related to each other based on their meaning.

options.label: B
options.text: It's a space of words that are constructed by asking experts.

options.label: C
options.text: It's a space of words that is constructed by following the assumption that when two words are related, they tend to appear in the same sentences, in the same paragraphs, in the same documents.

options.label: D
options.text: It's a space of words that is constructed by analyzing the frequency of words in a given text.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of analyzing the space of words for some familiar words?

options.label: A
options.text: The words are randomly distributed throughout the space.

options.label: B
options.text: The words are organized into semantic neighborhoods.

options.label: C
options.text: The words are arranged in a hierarchical structure.

options.label: D
options.text: The words are not related to each other.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of projecting words into the space of words?

options.label: A
options.text: To analyze the meaning of individual words.

options.label: B
options.text: To analyze the relationship between words.

options.label: C
options.text: To analyze the history of a concept.

options.label: D
options.text: To analyze the frequency of words in a given text.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of analyzing the history of introspection in the ancient Greek tradition?

options.label: A
options.text: The concept of introspection was always present in ancient Greek literature.

options.label: B
options.text: The concept of introspection was absent in ancient Greek literature.

options.label: C
options.text: The concept of introspection was introduced in ancient Greek literature around 500 BCE.

options.label: D
options.text: The concept of introspection increased rapidly in ancient Greek literature around 400 BCE.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of analyzing the history of introspection in the Judeo-Christian tradition?

options.label: A
options.text: The concept of introspection was absent in Judeo-Christian literature.

options.label: B
options.text: The concept of introspection was introduced in Judeo-Christian literature around 500 BCE.

options.label: C
options.text: The concept of introspection increased rapidly in Judeo-Christian literature around 400 BCE.

options.label: D
options.text: The concept of introspection increased rapidly in Judeo-Christian literature around 300 CE.

multiple-choice.question: What is the measure of semantic coherence?

options.label: A
options.text: The measure of the persistence of speech within one semantic topic.

options.label: B
options.text: The measure of the frequency of words in a given text.

options.label: C
options.text: The measure of the relationship between words.

options.label: D
options.text: The measure of the meaning of individual words.

options.label: A
options.text: The algorithm could not predict the future onset of psychosis.

options.label: B
options.text: The algorithm could predict the future onset of psychosis with 50% accuracy.

options.label: C
options.text: The algorithm could predict the future onset of psychosis with 100% accuracy.

options.label: D
options.text: The algorithm could not distinguish between a group of schizophrenics and a control group.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential application of analyzing the semantic coherence of speech?

options.label: A
options.text: To analyze the meaning of individual words.

options.label: B
options.text: To analyze the relationship between words.

options.label: C
options.text: To analyze the history of a concept.

options.label: D
options.text: To predict the future onset of psychosis and provide early intervention.
